description.narrative: (Burundi): The Integrated Health Project strengthens the health system, community, and civil society's capacity to deliver quality reproductive, maternal, neonatal and child health (RMNCH), malaria, and HIV/AIDS services to reduce maternal and child morbidity and mortality, as well as malaria and HIV disease burdens. FY17 funds will be utilized as follows:..Malaria: Support community health workers testing and treating malaria and provide malaria prevention messaging. Improve the uptake of malaria prevention services, build capacity in diagnosis, prevention, treatment, and management of the supply chain for health care workers. Support outreach sites for testing and treatment...RMNCH: Provide basic and comprehensive emergency obstetric and newborn care to prevent hemorrhaging (cause of maternal mortality), improve essential newborn care and family planning services, and strengthen the integration of prevention services for malaria during pregnancy and mother to child transmission of HIV.
